docs.snippet: It’s a day to make black-eyed peas, and to dream about dinners for early 2018, whether it’s pan-roasted cauliflower or pork cutlets Parm.
Monday: A nonprofit offers financial literacy lessons to young people, an end to the cold spell, and The Times and PBS start a book club.

headline.main: New York Today: Teaching Teens the Financial Ropes

docs.snippet: India’s Paytm and global heavyweights like Google are moving aggressively to persuade reluctant Indians to give up their rupee notes.

headline.main: India Clings to Cash, Even as Tech Firms Push Digital Money

docs.snippet: The talk in Davos isn’t about enriching the lives of just the top 1 percent.

headline.print_headline: Is the Business World All About Greed?
headline.main: Is the Business World All About Greed?

docs.snippet: Khaled Ali, the last major challenger in Egypt’s presidential race, quit the race on Wednesday, clearing the field for President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

headline.main: And Then There Was One: Last Challenger to Egypt’s Sisi Drops Out

docs.snippet: Clare Waight Keller writes a modern narrative, while Giorgio Armani tells a shorts story and John Galliano mythologizes Maison Margiela.

headline.main: The Book of Clare: Givenchy’s Powerful Return to Couture

docs.snippet: A collection of images showcases the intensity of the Gold Rush in the 19th century, around the same time the daguerreotype enjoyed a similar surge in popularity. Some of the images evoke a certain Brooklyn demographic.

headline.main: The Age of Gold and Daguerreotypes

docs.abstract: A collection of images showcases the intensity of the Gold Rush in the 19th century, around the same time the daguerreotype enjoyed a similar surge in popularity. Some of the images evoke a certain Brooklyn demographic.

docs.snippet: The vice president promised the quicker-than-expected move during a visit to Israel’s Parliament, where Arab lawmakers staged a protest and were removed.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem Will Open in ’19, Pence Says
headline.main: Mike Pence Says U.S. Embassy Will Open in Jerusalem Next Year

docs.snippet: The company will be taking part in the suppression of freedoms abroad while espousing high-minded values at home.

headline.main: Apple Can’t Resist Playing by China’s Rules

docs.snippet: Through images and interviews, Brian Cohen and his collective of photographers tell the stories of the immigrants of the city.

headline.main: Migration Stories From the Stoops of Pittsburgh
